meanings.definition: excessively protective or cautious in safeguarding someone or something
meanings.sent1: She is so overprotective of her little brother that she won't let him play outside alone.
meanings.sent2: The overprotective mother always insists on checking the safety of every playground before allowing her child to play.
meanings.sent3: The overprotective dog barked loudly at a harmless butterfly, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: The overprotective security guard never let anyone enter the building without thorough inspection.
meanings.sent5: The overprotective father wrapped his child in layers of clothing even on a warm summer day.

meanings.definition: characterized by excessive concern for the safety and well-being of others
meanings.sent1: The overprotective teacher always makes sure her students wear helmets during recess.
meanings.sent2: Being overprotective, she insisted on driving her friends home to ensure they arrived safely.
meanings.sent3: The overprotective lifeguard blew his whistle when he saw a child splashing in the shallow end.
meanings.sent4: The overprotective nurse double-checked every medication dosage before administering it to the patient.
meanings.sent5: The overprotective friend never failed to remind others to wear seat belts while driving.
